intro: Eriocoma hemsleyana, commonly known as the Hemsley's eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Eriocoma hemsleyana is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
